content:
Yes, Ohio State University provides support and resources for minority entrepreneurs in its alumni network as well. Here are some examples:

1) The Office of Diversity and Inclusion - This office supports underrepresented minorities at Ohio State University through a variety of programs, including mentorship, networking, and access to resources for entrepreneurship.

2) The National Society of Black Engineers - This student and alumni organization provides support to black engineers and promotes diversity in the field. The organization provides mentorship and networking opportunities for alumni entrepreneurs.

3) The Latinx Student Association - This student organization works to promote the interests and well-being of Latinx students and alumni at Ohio State University. The organization provides access to resources for entrepreneurship and professional development.

4) The Diversity in Business Club - This student and alumni organization provides networking opportunities and professional development resources for underrepresented minorities in the business field.

5) The Ohio Minority Business Assistance Center - This center, located on Ohio State University's campus, provides business development resources, financing assistance, and other services to minority-owned businesses in Ohio.

These initiatives and organizations are just a few examples of Ohio State University's commitment to supporting minority entrepreneurs in its alumni network.
